resources.string: Find scans of the same tag
An error occurred while configuring NFC
The NXP TagWriter app is needed to complete this action. Please, install it and try this action again.
"For support select About For help select Help"
There seems to be a problem accessing this tag. Please, remove the tag and press OK to retry
Please, turn on NFC to use TagInfo
TagInfo needs NFC capability. It seems your device has a problem with NFC
Send a registration request by tapping the button below.
Tap an NFC tag for info…
List of abbreviations and technical terms

This tab contains information on the manufacturer of the IC (chip) inside the tag and the IC type used (if detected). A list of applications possibly supported by the tag will also reported in this tab.
This tab shows various further functional details detected about the IC used inside the tag.

"The NXP TagInfo application allows you to browse the content of public transport and payment cards that are based on a contactless technology compatible with NFC in your device. In addition to its use as value checker NXP TagInfo will identify many additional applications. On top of the consumer focused functions it explores the full details of openly accessible information on contactless cards, tags and NFC-enabled items. In the following text we will use the simplified term tag for all contactless cards, tags and NFC-enabled items in general that can be accessed by your device.
The menu of the application provides access to options to share an NFC data set with other applications and to email all information as shown on the four tabs of the application.
All information as displayed will also be stored and is available for later viewing via the history option in the menu. The history option allows browsing through previously inspected tags. There is a search option in the application menu to quickly find the desired item. By long pressing an item, a context menu will be shown for that item.
The settings option allows configuring some application behavior such as the amount of details shown on the screen and user interface aspects such as disabling the sound (except for sounds generated by the Android system), the vibration and more. It also allows making the NXP TagInfo work so that it does pop up as a target application in the application chooser of the Android system when NFC related activities are detected.
A list of abbreviations and technical terms as used by NXP TagInfo is included at the end of the help text.
The application user interface is split into four tabs (“screens”). Each of them can be selected by a tap on the icons at the top of the screen. The tabs are used to group the information that NXP TagInfo has read from the tag. The information split per tab is explained below."
This tab contains the content and details of NFC Forum data sets possibly detected on the tag.

This tab lists the supported technologies of the tag detected as named by the Android NFC API as well as the related International Standards. In addition, this tab provides parameter information related to the supported communication modes and protocols about the IC used inside the tag. Furthermore, this tab displays the complete memory contents of supported tag types when this has been enabled in the settings.

"To overrule this behaviour, fill in the UID of a tag below. The password will then always be submitted to this tag.
"USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
The password will only be submitted when the AUTHLIM setting can be read without password and is equal to 0. This prevents accidental locking of a tag.
Do not interfere with other apps
Set up and manage authentication keys
This Android device does not support MIFARE Classic technology
When an NXP IC or an NFC data set is detected
Control which tags will be detected
Allow to edit the subject before sharing
At the start or finish of a scan
At the start or finish of a scan (will not mute system sounds)
When a new tag is scanned
May take a long time to complete!
Enter a 6-byte MIFARE key as a hexadecimal value
When starting or finishing a scan
Error loading MIFARE Application Directory database
Sorry, an error occured while deleting items
Sorry, an error occurred while accessing this file
Sorry, no permission to read this file
Sorry, an error occurred while writing data
Sorry, this function has not been implemented yet
Sorry, the MIFARE key value is invalid. Please, enter a hexadecimal value less than 0xFFFFFFFFFFFF
Not all required fields have been filled in!
Sorry, there is no application installed to handle this Android application record
Sorry, there is no application installed to handle this MIME type
Sorry, there is no application installed to handle this URI
Sorry, no NFC data set found
Sorry, could not find any scans
"Sorry, no application found. Did you install NXP TagWriter?"
Sorry, an error occurred parsing the scan report
Sorry, could not save scan report
Sorry, there seem to be serious errors communicating with the tag. Scanning it may not be possible.
Sorry, tag communication was interrupted. The result may be incomplete or inaccurate.
